I don't like that mix too, but what I can't see is how I can bound an instance of MyClass (which already exists when the test runs) to a instance of TestMyClass which are launched by the TestRunner. My problem is that I can't use the 'new' operator to create instances of MyClass inside TestMyClass because I'm tied to the framework factory method. Perhaps if I could use a constructor in the test class with an instance of the class to be tested passed as a parameter... But in that case I think that I couldn't use the TestRunner.run( -- ); I'd need to make my own TestRunner where I could run a suite over a concrete instance of MyClass. 
Makes this any sense? Perhaps I should practice a bit more with the JUnit framewok to get a better understand about how it could fit. Even more, I should practice more with complex structures in Java to get fluency in my designs - the beginnings are always hard :-).
